fields.title: Environmental Change
fields.description: This category includes all signals originating from natural phenomena, including space – e.g. major asteroid earth strike, solar storm, volcanism, lack of pollinators in Europe, etc.

fields.title: Social Change
fields.description: This category includes all signals that find their origin in human and social behaviours. Signals can be changes in geopolitics, economic paradigms, consumer preferences, production patterns, etc. - e.g. disintegration of EU, insects as food, zero waste society, etc.

fields.title: Technological Change
fields.description: This category include all signals originating strictly from technological developments - e.g. 3D printing in households, Thorium reactors, modification of human genome, etc.

fields.title: Most likely positive
fields.description: Overall influence of signal is generally viewed as positive – e.g. zero waste society, etc.

fields.title: Most likely negative
fields.description: Overall influence of signal is generally viewed as negative – e.g. lack of pollinators in Europe, GMOs impact on ecosystems, etc

fields.title: Mixed
fields.description: Overall influence of signal is viewed as both positive and negative – e.g. 3D  printing in households, etc

fields.title: Very uncertain
fields.description: There is not enough information to assess possible impacts of the signal

fields.title: European
fields.description: Europe-wide influence – e.g. lack of pollinators in Europe

fields.title: National
fields.description: Influence on one or a few EU member states

fields.title: Regional
fields.description: Influence on one or a few regions in the EU – e.g. Danube river basin

fields.title: Local
fields.description: Influence on limited location only – e.g. specific industrial hazards
